docs.abstract: The president has become increasingly concerned as Dr. Anthony S. Fauci has grown bolder in correcting his falsehoods about the spread of the coronavirus.
docs.snippet: The president has become increasingly concerned as Dr. Anthony S. Fauci has grown bolder in correcting his falsehoods about the spread of the coronavirus.
docs.lead_paragraph: President Trump has praised Dr. Anthony S. Fauci as a “major television star.” He has tried to demonstrate that the administration is giving him free rein to speak. And he has deferred to Dr. Fauci’s opinion several times at the coronavirus task force’s televised briefings.

headline.main: Trump Has Given Unusual Leeway to Fauci, but Aides Say He’s Losing His Patience

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases

docs.abstract: Federal prosecutors accused President Nicolás Maduro of participating in a narco-terrorism conspiracy, in a major escalation of the Trump administration’s efforts to pressure him to leave office.
docs.snippet: Federal prosecutors accused President Nicolás Maduro of participating in a narco-terrorism conspiracy, in a major escalation of the Trump administration’s efforts to pressure him to leave office.
docs.lead_paragraph: President Nicolás Maduro of Venezuela was indicted in the United States on Thursday in a decades-long narco-terrorism and international cocaine trafficking conspiracy in which, prosecutors said, he led a violent drug cartel even as he ascended to the top of government.

headline.main: Venezuelan Leader Maduro Is Charged in the U.S. With Drug Trafficking
headline.print_headline: U.S. Charges Venezuela’s Maduro With Trafficking and Narco-Terrorism

byline.original: By William K. Rashbaum, Benjamin Weiser and Katie Benner

docs.abstract: Now part of the long list of women the president has insulted: a governor, a reporter, the head of General Motors and, of course, the House speaker.
docs.snippet: Now part of the long list of women the president has insulted: a governor, a reporter, the head of General Motors and, of course, the House speaker.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — As he confronts a pandemic, President Trump’s attention has also been directed at a more familiar foe: those he feels are challenging him, and particularly women.

headline.main: Trump’s Virus Defense Is Often an Attack, and the Target Is Often a Woman
headline.print_headline: Subject to Trump’s Taunts, Be She Governor, C.E.O., Reporter or Speaker

docs.abstract: With the $2 trillion economic stimulus just signed into law on Friday, Washington is already considering a fourth response package. In an exclusive interview, Speaker Nancy Pelosi detailed what she wants next.
docs.snippet: With the $2 trillion economic stimulus just signed into law on Friday, Washington is already considering a fourth response package. In an exclusive interview, Speaker Nancy Pelosi detailed what she wants next.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — As the toll of the coronavirus continues to rise — with more state shutdowns, extensive new layoffs and overwhelmed hospitals — lawmakers and administration officials are turning their focus to what more is needed to counter the pandemic and protect a battered economy.

headline.main: Nancy Pelosi Is Already Talking About the Next Stimulus Bill for Coronavirus Relief
headline.print_headline: As Pandemic Worsens, Washington Plans a Sequel to $2 Trillion in Aid

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Coronavirus Aid, Relief, and Economic Security Act (2020)

docs.abstract: A study published last fall went unheeded. One of its authors now says economic shutdowns to fight the coronavirus could last up to eight months.
docs.snippet: A study published last fall went unheeded. One of its authors now says economic shutdowns to fight the coronavirus could last up to eight months.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — White House economists published a study last September that warned a pandemic disease could kill a half million Americans and devastate the economy.

headline.main: White House Economists Warned in 2019 a Pandemic Could Devastate America
headline.print_headline: White House Economists Warned in 2019 of Devastating Toll of a Pandemic

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: White House Council of Economic Advisers

docs.abstract: Dr. Anthony S. Fauci, the nation’s leading infectious disease expert, and Dr. Deborah L. Birx, who is coordinating the response, called it “our real number” but pledged to try to reduce it.
docs.snippet: Dr. Anthony S. Fauci, the nation’s leading infectious disease expert, and Dr. Deborah L. Birx, who is coordinating the response, called it “our real number” but pledged to try to reduce it.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The top government scientists battling the coronavirus estimated on Tuesday that the deadly pathogen could kill 100,000 to 240,000 Americans as it ravages the country despite social distancing measures that have closed schools, banned large gatherings, limited travel and forced people to stay in their homes.

headline.main: Coronavirus May Kill 100,000 to 240,000 in U.S. Despite Actions, Officials Say
headline.print_headline: Grim Toll Projected, Even With Distancing

byline.original: By Michael D. Shear, Michael Crowley and James Glanz

docs.abstract: The freshman Democrat and combat veteran will help set up hospitals in his Staten Island district and other parts of New York City.
docs.snippet: The freshman Democrat and combat veteran will help set up hospitals in his Staten Island district and other parts of New York City.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Representative Max Rose, a freshman Democrat from New York, announced on Tuesday that he would deploy with the National Guard on Wednesday to assist the hard-hit city’s coronavirus response efforts, making him the first member of Congress to do so.

headline.main: Congressman Max Rose Deploys With National Guard for Coronavirus Relief

docs.abstract: Democrats and President Trump are discussing a multitrillion-dollar infrastructure plan that could create thousands of jobs to salve an economy battered by the coronavirus.
docs.snippet: Democrats and President Trump are discussing a multitrillion-dollar infrastructure plan that could create thousands of jobs to salve an economy battered by the coronavirus.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — As Congress and the White House contemplate the next phase of the government response to the coronavirus pandemic and its economic toll, Democrats and President Trump are increasingly raising the prospect of enacting a multitrillion-dollar infrastructure plan that could create thousands of jobs.

headline.main: ‘Infrastructure Week’ Returns as Trump and Democrats Eye Post-Virus Jobs Plan
headline.print_headline: Crisis Resurrects an Idea: Trillions for Infrastructure

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Coronavirus Aid, Relief, and Economic Security Act (2020)

docs.abstract: Under the best-case scenario presented on Tuesday, more Americans will die from the coronavirus in the weeks and months to come than died in the Korean and Vietnam Wars combined.
docs.snippet: Under the best-case scenario presented on Tuesday, more Americans will die from the coronavirus in the weeks and months to come than died in the Korean and Vietnam Wars combined.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Five weeks ago, when there were 60 confirmed cases of the coronavirus in the United States, President Trump expressed little alarm. “This is a flu,” he said. “This is like a flu.” He was still likening it to an ordinary flu as late as Friday.

headline.main: Trump Confronts a New Reality Before an Expected Wave of Disease and Death
headline.print_headline: As Numbers Sink In, New Reality Confronts A More Somber Trump

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases

docs.abstract: President Trump appeared eager to bask in the warm reception of a conservative audience, who spent the conference listening to speakers road-testing messages for his re-election campaign.
docs.snippet: President Trump appeared eager to bask in the warm reception of a conservative audience, who spent the conference listening to speakers road-testing messages for his re-election campaign.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump crouched underneath his microphone on Saturday, mimicking the height of Michael R. Bloomberg, the billionaire former mayor of New York City who is running for president.

headline.main: At CPAC, Trump Takes Aim at Rivals
headline.print_headline: Trump Heaps Scorn on Rivals and Praise on Himself at CPAC
